title: Developing Design Problem-Solving Strategies Through Comparative Analysis

context.prior_knowledge: Basic problem-solving methodology understanding, fundamental language skills
context.additional_context: Asynchronous online education conducted in a limited technological environment centered on smartphones. Course for novice professionals in medical/legal/technical fields to develop comparative analysis capabilities for various design problems

learning_goals: Learners can compare and explain characteristics of different design problem spaces (architecture, mechanical engineering, instructional design)
Learners can utilize tools to analyze problem-solving processes in real-world design tasks versus non-design tasks
Learners can develop design strategies applicable to their professional fields (medical/legal/technical) based on comparative analysis results

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
